history.content:
Data8 is offered in both the fall and spring semesters so you would only have to wait a semester if you couldn't get into the course in the spring. 

There's no harm in keeping an eye on cal central to see if they expand the labs (which would allow you to get onto the waitlist), but as a heads up, Data8 is now an extremely popular class, so getting onto the (large) waitlist doesn't guarantee you will be able to get into the course.

children.subject: Update: Data 8 just expanded with new labs..

history.content:
So I had no idea that Data 8 would fill up so quickly, I tried to phase 2 it but it's completely filled. I can't add it because all the lab sections are marked "full," so I can't even get on the waitlist even though the lecture itself is marked "Open."

Should I try to bank on being able to get in during the adjustment period? Is it worth trying or do I have to wait a whole year before I can take the course?

Thanks
history.subject: Data 8 Adjustment Period?
